meaning: take (a short extract) from a text
example_sentence: Compare sample Rust and Python code excerpts to explore how the distinction in purpose and capabilities between statement-centric language and more expression-oriented strategies can lead to varying programming approaches.

meaning: appoint (someone) to a specified office or post.
example_sentence: (Common usecases for statement) Assigning a value to a variable without requiring computation of the value. For instance, x = 1 because it designates the value of x as a literal -- the integer 1 in this case -- rather than computing a new value and using the variable to store the result.

meaning: written or spoken communication or debate.
(of a substance) made by chemical synthesis, especially to imitate a natural product.
an innate, typically fixed pattern of behavior in animals in response to certain stimuli.
example_sentence: that’s a great instinct to understand what’s going on under the hood.
